wikipedia_page.main: John Martis (born 30 March 1940) is a Scottish former professional footballer who made nearly 500 appearances in the Scottish Football League and was capped once for the Scotland national side.

response: Some notable players in the Junior era to step up from the club include Bobby Hogg (Celtic) and John Martis (Motherwell) with both playing for Scotland later in their careers, George Miller, who won the Scottish Cup in 1961 with Dunfermline Athletic and Davie White who played for and managed Clyde before managing Rangers. Hogg is also Royal Albert's most capped Junior international with three caps in 1931,
* John Martis (born 1940), Scottish former professional footballer
